title: Statistical Advantages/Disadvantages in Prolonging Dog Life Study
question_text: Suppose a large dog food company has a new prototype that is supposed to prolong the life of dogs. The company randomly selects two groups of $100\text{ dogs}$ each: one group will be fed this new food for the duration of their entire lives; the other group will be fed the leading competitorâ€™s brand of dog food. Variables such as exercise, location, and medical treatment are all controlled for. However, the company needs to decide whether to use only a specific breed of dog or include a variety of dogs. What is a statistical advantage of using only one specific breed of dog for this study? A statistical disadvantage?

choices.text: Advantage: less variability in results   Disadvantage: difficult to generalize the results to other breeds
Advantage: less expensive to run the experiment   Disadvantage: difficult to generalize the results to other breeds
Advantage: more detailed information   Disadvantage: more lurking variables
Advantage: less variability in results   Disadvantage: difficult to obtain dogs of all the same breed
Advantage: less expensive to run the experiment   Disadvantage: more lurking variables
